channel.title: BBC News - Business
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: McDonald's runs out of milkshakes in England, Scotland and Wales
item.description: Supply issues at English, Welsh and Scottish outlets are due to the lorry driver shortage, the firm says.

item.title: Airbnb offers free accommodation for 20,000 Afghan refugees
item.description: Airbnb says it will house 20,000 Afghan refugees at no charge to help them resettle across the world.

item.title: Retail bosses demand more protection for UK workers
item.description: Industry leaders are calling on the UK government to follow Scotland’s lead on protecting shop workers.

item.title: Didi: China ride-hailing giant halts plan to launch in UK
item.description: It comes as Chinese firms face scrutiny by Western nations and as Beijing cracks down on data privacy.

item.title: Retail survivors: The London shops that have been trading for centuries
item.description: Four London retail survivors explain how they are faring after 18 months of unprecedented turmoil.

item.title: Prisoners to plug worker shortage in meat industry
item.description: Meat industry leaders tell the BBC the government is "keen" to link up businesses with inmates.

item.title: UK recovery slows as staff shortages plague firms
item.description: August has seen an "abnormally large slowdown" in economic activity, says a closely watched survey.

item.title: Covid: Government warns Covid test firms over misleading prices
item.description: More than 80 Covid test firms are issued with warnings and could be taken off the government's website.

item.title: Bitcoin back above $50,000 as recovery continues
item.description: The digital currency is rebounding from a deep slump as more mainstream financial firms recognise it.

item.title: Gambling: Poorer UK towns found to have the most betting shops, study shows
item.description: Areas with the highest number of betting shops per capita include Glasgow, Liverpool and Middlesbrough.

item.title: Chip giant's IPO hit by Beijing crackdown on business
item.description: The share listing of BYD Semiconductor has been suspended due to a regulatory investigation.

item.title: Wildfires: Provence wine producers assess impact of destruction
item.description: There are fears the fires that have hit rosé vineyards in Provence will push up prices.

item.title: Climate change: Will I still be able to fly in a net zero world?
item.description: A new study asks if lifestyle changes including an end to flying will be necessary to reach net zero?

item.title: Why phone scams are so difficult to tackle
item.description: Phone fraud, both via calls and text messages, has soared during the pandemic.

item.title: Brazil hopes the world will get a taste for its favourite spirit
item.description: With domestic sales of cachaça falling last year, Brazilian producers want to export more.

item.title: Love and money: Why breaking-up is so hard to do
item.description: More people are looking for help in paying for divorces after relationships ended during Covid.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Don't ask for all your funding up front
item.description: Don't ask for all your funding at once, says Zazuu CEO Kay Akinwunmi, but in smaller chunks.

item.title: Never mind going electric, where will we park?
item.description: UK roads are already jam-packed and that looks set to get worse as more people snap up EVs.

item.title: Just how hard is it to recycle a jumbo jet?
item.description: Thousands of aircraft were left on the tarmac due to Covid, and many will now be broken up for parts.

item.title: Would you let a robot lawyer defend you?
item.description: Why artificial intelligence is increasingly being used by the legal profession.
